title: Leviticus Chapter 22 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Leviticus chapter 22 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Leviticus Chapter 22 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Leviticus Chapter 22.

questions.question: To whom did the LORD speak in Leviticus 22:1?
options: Moses
Aaron
The children of Israel
The priests
questions.correctAnswer: Moses
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:1 states that the LORD spake unto Moses.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 22:2, who must separate themselves from the holy things of the children of Israel?
options: Aaron and his sons
The children of Israel
The strangers
The Levites
questions.correctAnswer: Aaron and his sons
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:2 instructs Aaron and his sons to separate themselves from the holy things.

questions.question: What will happen to anyone from the seed of Aaron who goes to the holy things with uncleanness upon him according to Leviticus 22:3?
options: That soul shall be cut off from the LORD's presence
They shall be blessed
They shall eat the holy things
They shall be forgiven
questions.correctAnswer: That soul shall be cut off from the LORD's presence
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:3 says that anyone with uncleanness who goes to the holy things shall be cut off from God's presence.

questions.question: True or False: Leviticus 22:4 says a man with leprosy or a running issue may eat of the holy things before he is clean.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:4 states that a man who is a leper or has a running issue shall not eat of the holy things until he is clean.

questions.question: What must a person do if they touch something unclean before eating the holy things, according to Leviticus 22:6?
options: Wash his flesh with water
Offer a sacrifice
Fast for a day
Pray to the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: Wash his flesh with water
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:6 says the soul shall be unclean until evening and must wash with water before eating holy things.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 22:8, what shall not be eaten to avoid defiling oneself?
options: That which died of itself or was torn by beasts
Only animals killed by the priests
Animals with blemishes
Only birds
questions.correctAnswer: That which died of itself or was torn by beasts
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:8 commands not to eat what dies of itself or is torn by beasts to avoid defilement.

questions.question: Who is forbidden from eating the holy things, according to Leviticus 22:10?
options: Strangers, sojourners, and hired servants of the priest
Only the children of Israel
The priests' sons
The Levites
questions.correctAnswer: Strangers, sojourners, and hired servants of the priest
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:10 states that strangers, sojourners, and hired servants shall not eat of the holy thing.

questions.question: True or False: According to Leviticus 22:12, a priest's daughter married to a stranger may eat of the holy offerings.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:12 says the priest's daughter married to a stranger may not eat of the holy offerings.

questions.question: If a man eats of the holy things unknowingly, what must he do according to Leviticus 22:14?
options: Add a fifth part to it and give it to the priest
Offer a burnt offering
Fast for three days
Confess before the congregation
questions.correctAnswer: Add a fifth part to it and give it to the priest
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:14 instructs that one who eats holy things unknowingly must add a fifth part and give it to the priest.

questions.question: What kind of animal must be offered for burnt offerings according to Leviticus 22:19?
options: A male without blemish
Any animal
Only female animals
Animals with blemishes
questions.correctAnswer: A male without blemish
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:19 commands offering a male without blemish of the beeves, sheep, or goats for burnt offerings.

questions.question: True or False: Animals that are blind, broken, or maimed may be offered to the LORD according to Leviticus 22:22.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:22 prohibits offering animals that are blind, broken, maimed, or have other defects.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 22:27, how many days must a bullock, sheep, or goat be under its dam before it is accepted for offering?
options: Seven days
Three days
Fourteen days
One day
questions.correctAnswer: Seven days
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:27 states the animal must be seven days under the dam before it is accepted for offering.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from Leviticus 22:30: 'On the same day it shall be eaten up; ye shall leave none of it until the ______.'
options: morrow
evening
sabbath
festival
questions.correctAnswer: morrow
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:30 commands that none of the sacrifice be left until the morrow.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 22:28, what is forbidden to be done on the same day?
options: Killing a cow or ewe and her young both in one day
Eating the holy things after sunset
Offering blemished animals
Allowing strangers to eat holy things
questions.correctAnswer: Killing a cow or ewe and her young both in one day
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:28 forbids killing a cow or ewe and her young both in one day.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 22:32, what will the LORD be among the children of Israel?
options: Hallowed
Angry
Silent
Punishing
questions.correctAnswer: Hallowed
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:32 says the LORD will be hallowed among the children of Israel.

medium.title: Leviticus Chapter 22 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Leviticus Chapter 22 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does Leviticus 22 teach us about the importance of holiness and separation in our Christian walk?
options: We must separate ourselves from holy things to avoid profaning God's name
We should treat holy things casually since God forgives all
Separation from holy things is optional for believers
Holiness is only for priests, not for all believers
questions.correctAnswer: We must separate ourselves from holy things to avoid profaning God's name
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:2 instructs Aaron and his sons to separate themselves from the holy things so as not to profane God's holy name. This teaches the importance of holiness and reverence before God.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with guilt after unintentionally eating something considered holy. Based on Leviticus 22, what biblical truth would you share about remedy and responsibility?
options: They should add a fifth part to the offering and give it to the priest
They must fast for seven days to be forgiven
They should confess and offer a burnt sacrifice
They need not do anything since it was unintentional
questions.correctAnswer: They should add a fifth part to the offering and give it to the priest
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:14 explains that if one eats of the holy thing unwittingly, they must add a fifth part and give it with the holy thing to the priest, showing responsibility even in unintentional error.

questions.question: What does Leviticus 22 teach about the qualities required for animals offered in sacrifice and its implications for Christian integrity?
options: Only animals without blemish are acceptable, reflecting the need for purity and integrity
Any animal may be offered as long as it is from Israel
Animals with minor defects are acceptable if the heart is right
Only the largest animals are acceptable for offering
questions.correctAnswer: Only animals without blemish are acceptable, reflecting the need for purity and integrity
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:19-20 emphasizes that offerings must be male without blemish, teaching us that God desires purity and integrity in what we offer Him.

questions.question: How does Leviticus 22 instruct us to handle holiness in relation to family and marriage?
options: A priest's daughter married to a stranger may not eat of the holy things
All family members have equal rights to holy offerings regardless of marriage
Marriage does not affect access to holy things
Only sons, not daughters, receive holy offerings
questions.correctAnswer: A priest's daughter married to a stranger may not eat of the holy things
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:12 specifies that if a priest's daughter marries a stranger, she may not eat of the holy things, highlighting the importance of family and covenant relationships in holiness.

questions.question: A believer asks about the consequences of profaning holy things at church. What biblical truth from Leviticus 22 would you share?
options: Those who profane holy things bear sin and may die
Profaning holy things has no real consequence if repented
Only priests are held accountable for profaning holy things
Profaning holy things is a minor offense
questions.correctAnswer: Those who profane holy things bear sin and may die
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:9 warns that profaning holy things causes sin and death, teaching the seriousness of respecting God's holiness.

questions.question: What does Leviticus 22 teach about the preparation and acceptance of sacrificial animals in relation to patience and obedience?
options: Animals must be seven days under their dam before being acceptable
Animals can be offered immediately after birth
Animals must be at least one year old
Animals are acceptable only after being weaned for a month
questions.correctAnswer: Animals must be seven days under their dam before being acceptable
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:27 instructs that animals must stay seven days with their mother before being offered, illustrating patience and obedience in worship.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 22, who among the following is prohibited from eating the holy things, and what does this teach us about reverence and discipline?
options: Anyone unclean or with a physical condition like leprosy
All Israelites are allowed without restriction
Only strangers are prohibited
Anyone who has not fasted before eating
questions.correctAnswer: Anyone unclean or with a physical condition like leprosy
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:4-6 forbids those who are unclean, including lepers, from eating holy things until they are clean, teaching the need for reverence and spiritual discipline.

questions.question: How does Leviticus 22 guide believers regarding generosity and stewardship when offering sacrifices?
options: Offerings must be without blemish, showing the best is given to God
It is acceptable to offer damaged or blemished animals
Only small animals should be given as offerings
Offerings can be substituted with money
questions.correctAnswer: Offerings must be without blemish, showing the best is given to God
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:21-22 emphasizes that sacrifices must be perfect and without blemish, teaching generosity and giving our best to God.

questions.question: True or False: According to Leviticus 22, a hired servant or sojourner among the priests may eat of the holy things.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:10 clearly states that no stranger, including hired servants or sojourners of the priest, shall eat of the holy thing, emphasizing respect for holiness and proper boundaries.

questions.question: True or False: Leviticus 22 teaches that God sanctifies His people and commands them to keep His commandments to avoid profaning His holy name.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:31-32 teaches that God sanctifies His people and commands them to obey His laws, so His holy name is not profaned among them.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: According to Leviticus 22:30, when you offer a sacrifice of thanksgiving unto the LORD, it ________ be eaten on the same day.
options: shall
may
should not
can
questions.correctAnswer: shall
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:30 commands that the sacrifice of thanksgiving shall be eaten on the same day, teaching prompt gratitude and fellowship.

questions.question: How does Leviticus 22 instruct believers to handle offerings from strangers, and what principle does this teach about purity in worship?
options: Offerings from strangers with blemishes are not accepted
All offerings from strangers are accepted regardless of condition
Strangers may freely participate in all offerings
Offerings from strangers are accepted only if blessed by a priest
questions.correctAnswer: Offerings from strangers with blemishes are not accepted
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:25 teaches that offerings from strangers containing corruption or blemishes are not accepted, underscoring the principle of purity in worship.

questions.question: A believer is tempted to offer a flawed sacrifice due to lack of resources. What guidance does Leviticus 22 provide about offering sacrifices with defects?
options: Sacrifices with defects are not acceptable for vows but may be freewill offerings
Any sacrifice is acceptable if given with good intent
Defective animals are acceptable if they are all one has
Sacrifices should be avoided if perfect animals are not available
questions.correctAnswer: Sacrifices with defects are not acceptable for vows but may be freewill offerings
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:23 explains that defective animals may be offered as freewill offerings but not for vows, highlighting the seriousness in giving to God.

questions.question: Leviticus 22 forbids killing a cow or ewe and her young on the same day. What practical Christian virtue does this teach?
options: Compassion and respect for life
Efficiency in sacrifice
Strict legalism without mercy
Indifference to animals
questions.correctAnswer: Compassion and respect for life
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:28 forbids killing a mother and her young on the same day, teaching compassion and respect for life.

questions.question: What does Leviticus 22 teach about the need for cleansing before partaking in holy things and its application to spiritual discipline?
options: One must wash and be clean before eating holy things
Cleansing is unnecessary if the heart is pure
Only priests need to cleanse themselves
Cleansing is symbolic and optional
questions.correctAnswer: One must wash and be clean before eating holy things
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:6-7 emphasizes washing and being clean before eating holy things, teaching the importance of spiritual discipline and purity.

hard.title: Leviticus Chapter 22 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Leviticus Chapter 22.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 22, what is the consequence for a priest who approaches the holy offerings with uncleanness on him?
options: He shall be cut off from the presence of the LORD
He shall be fined and disciplined by the elders
He shall be publicly shamed and exiled
He shall be allowed to eat after purification
questions.correctAnswer: He shall be cut off from the presence of the LORD
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:3 clearly states that anyone of Aaron's seed who goes to the holy things with uncleanness shall be cut off from the LORD's presence, emphasizing the sanctity required before approaching holy offerings.

questions.question: What ritual purification is required before a priest who touched anything unclean can eat the holy offerings, according to Leviticus 22?
options: He must wash his flesh with water and wait until evening
He must offer a burnt offering
He must fast for seven days
He must perform a ceremonial sacrifice
questions.correctAnswer: He must wash his flesh with water and wait until evening
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:6-7 details that the priest who is unclean must wash his flesh with water and remain unclean until evening before eating the holy offerings, underscoring ritual purity tied to daily cycles.

questions.question: Who is forbidden to eat of the holy offerings in Leviticus 22?
options: Strangers, sojourners of the priest, or hired servants
Only priests who are unclean
All Israelites except the high priest
Only the Levites
questions.correctAnswer: Strangers, sojourners of the priest, or hired servants
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:10 prohibits strangers, sojourners of the priest, and hired servants from eating the holy things, highlighting the exclusivity of priestly privileges.

questions.question: What condition allows a priest's daughter, who is a widow or divorced with no children, to eat of her father's meat?
options: If she returns to her father's house as in her youth
If she remarries within the tribe of Levi
If she offers a sacrifice on behalf of the family
If she remains unmarried for a year
questions.correctAnswer: If she returns to her father's house as in her youth
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:13 specifies that a priest's daughter who is a widow or divorced and childless may eat her father's meat if she returns to her father's house, indicating familial restoration.

questions.question: What must a person do if they eat of the holy thing unwittingly, according to Leviticus 22?
options: Add a fifth part to it and give it to the priest with the holy thing
Offer a sin offering to atone
Confess openly before the congregation
Fast for three days
questions.correctAnswer: Add a fifth part to it and give it to the priest with the holy thing
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:14 states that if a person eats of the holy thing unknowingly, they must add a fifth part and give it to the priest, reflecting a principle of restitution and sanctification.

questions.question: Leviticus 22 demands that offerings made for vows or freewill offerings must be what kind of animal?
options: Male without blemish
Any animal regardless of condition
Female only
Only animals over one year old
questions.correctAnswer: Male without blemish
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:19 commands offering a male without blemish from the beeves, sheep, or goats for vows or freewill offerings, symbolizing perfection and purity.

questions.question: Which of the following blemishes disqualifies an animal from being offered as a sacrifice, according to Leviticus 22?
options: Blindness
Minor scratches
Short hair
Small size
questions.correctAnswer: Blindness
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:22 lists blindness among blemishes that disqualify animals from being offered, indicating that physical perfection is required for acceptable sacrifices.

questions.question: What does Leviticus 22 say about killing a cow or ewe and her young on the same day?
options: You shall not kill them both on the same day
It is allowed if for a sacrifice
It is encouraged for feasts
It must be done during festivals only
questions.correctAnswer: You shall not kill them both on the same day
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:28 forbids killing a cow or ewe and her young on the same day, a law reflecting compassion and respect for animal life.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 22, how long must a bullock, sheep, or goat be under its mother before it is accepted for an offering made by fire unto the LORD?
options: Seven days under the dam, accepted from the eighth day onward
Three days under the dam, accepted from the fourth day
One day under the dam, accepted immediately after
Fourteen days under the dam, accepted from the fifteenth day
questions.correctAnswer: Seven days under the dam, accepted from the eighth day onward
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:27 prescribes that the animal must be with its mother for seven days and may be offered from the eighth day, which may symbolize completeness and readiness.

questions.question: What is the penalty mentioned in Leviticus 22 for profaning the holy name by mishandling the holy offerings?
options: Bearing the iniquity of trespass and death
Community service
Exile from the camp
Loss of priestly privileges
questions.correctAnswer: Bearing the iniquity of trespass and death
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:16 warns that those who profane the holy offerings bear the iniquity of trespass and face death, emphasizing holiness and divine judgment.

questions.question: Leviticus 22 forbids offering bread of God from whose hand?
options: A stranger's hand
A Levite's hand
A priest's hand
An Israelite's hand
questions.correctAnswer: A stranger's hand
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:25 forbids offering bread of God from a stranger's hand due to corruption and blemishes, reflecting purity and covenant identity requirements.

questions.question: Which phrase in Leviticus 22 is repeated multiple times to emphasize God's sanctifying power over Israel and the priests?
options: "I am the LORD"
"Holy unto the LORD"
"Clean and unclean"
"Sacrifice and offering"
questions.correctAnswer: "I am the LORD"
questions.explanation: The phrase "I am the LORD" is repeated throughout Leviticus 22 (e.g., verses 2, 3, 8, 31, 32) to emphasize divine authority and sanctification over Israel and their offerings.

questions.question: True or False: According to Leviticus 22, priests could offer animals with minor defects as freewill offerings but not for vows.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:23 explains that animals with some defects may be offered as freewill offerings but are not accepted for fulfilling vows, indicating different standards for offerings.

questions.question: Which theme in Leviticus 22 foreshadows New Testament teachings on holiness and sanctification?
options: The strict separation of the holy and unclean
The dietary laws for common people
The establishment of the monarchy
The instructions for building the tabernacle
questions.correctAnswer: The strict separation of the holy and unclean
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22's emphasis on separating the holy from the unclean (e.g., verses 2-7) foreshadows New Testament themes of holiness and sanctification, such as in 1 Peter 1:15-16.

questions.question: What literary device is predominantly used in Leviticus 22 to emphasize God's commands and identity?
options: Repetition of "I am the LORD"
Parables
Chiasm
Allegory
questions.correctAnswer: Repetition of "I am the LORD"
questions.explanation: The repeated declaration "I am the LORD" serves as a refrain to reinforce God's authority and holiness, a common literary device in Leviticus emphasizing covenant identity.

questions.question: True or False: Leviticus 22 allows a priest to eat holy offerings if he has a running issue or leprosy before he is clean.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:4 explicitly forbids a priest who is a leper or has a running issue from eating holy things until he is clean, underscoring the importance of ritual purity.

theological.title: Leviticus Chapter 22 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Leviticus Chapter 22 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 22:2, what command did the LORD give to Aaron and his sons regarding the holy things of Israel?
options: They must separate themselves from the holy things to avoid profaning God's holy name
They should share the holy things with all Israelites regardless of status
They may use the holy things for personal gain
They can allow non-priests to handle the holy things
questions.correctAnswer: They must separate themselves from the holy things to avoid profaning God's holy name
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:2 commands Aaron and his sons to separate themselves from the holy things so they do not profane God's holy name, affirming God's holiness and the need for the priesthood to uphold sanctity (cf. Hebrews 7:26; 1 Peter 1:15-16; Exodus 19:6; 1 Thessalonians 4:7).

questions.question: What consequence is described in Leviticus 22:3 for anyone who approaches the holy things with uncleanness?
options: That soul shall be cut off from God's presence
They shall be fined by the community
They shall be allowed to purify and continue
They shall offer an additional sacrifice
questions.correctAnswer: That soul shall be cut off from God's presence
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:3 states that anyone who approaches holy things with uncleanness will be cut off from God's presence, illustrating the seriousness of holiness and separation from sin (cf. Isaiah 59:2; Romans 6:23; 1 Corinthians 6:9-10; Hebrews 10:29).

questions.question: Which condition disqualifies a descendant of Aaron from eating the holy things until they are clean, according to Leviticus 22:4?
options: Being a leper or having a running issue
Being over 50 years old
Being unmarried
Living outside Israel
questions.correctAnswer: Being a leper or having a running issue
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:4 specifies that any descendant of Aaron who is a leper or has a running issue must not eat the holy things until clean, emphasizing ritual purity requirements (cf. Leviticus 13:45-46; Numbers 19:11-22; 2 Corinthians 7:1; 1 John 1:7).

questions.question: Leviticus 22:10 states that no stranger shall eat of the holy thing. Who is explicitly excluded from eating the holy things?
options: Sojourners of the priest and hired servants
All Israelites
Levitical priests only
Foreign kings
questions.correctAnswer: Sojourners of the priest and hired servants
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:10 forbids sojourners and hired servants of the priests from eating the holy things, underscoring sanctity and exclusivity for the priestly family (cf. Numbers 18:8-9; Ezekiel 44:29; Hebrews 7:5; 1 Timothy 3:15).

questions.question: Under what condition may a priest eat of a soul he bought with his money, according to Leviticus 22:11?
options: If he has purchased them, they and those born in his house may eat of his meat
Only if they are of Israelite descent
Only if they are from the tribe of Levi
If they are free men
questions.correctAnswer: If he has purchased them, they and those born in his house may eat of his meat
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:11 allows a priest to eat of the holy things if he has bought a person with his money, including those born in his house, highlighting provision for household members (cf. Exodus 21:2-6; 1 Corinthians 9:13-14; Deuteronomy 12:18; 1 Timothy 5:18).

questions.question: According to Leviticus 22:12, who among the priest's family is forbidden to eat of the holy things?
options: A priest's daughter married to a stranger
A priest's son who is unmarried
A priest's widow
A priest's servant
questions.correctAnswer: A priest's daughter married to a stranger
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:12 forbids a priest's daughter married to a stranger from eating of the holy things, emphasizing purity and separation within the priestly line (cf. Ezra 10:3-8; Nehemiah 13:23-27; Deuteronomy 7:3-4; 2 Corinthians 6:14).

questions.question: What restitution is required if a person eats of the holy thing unwittingly, according to Leviticus 22:14?
options: They shall add a fifth part and give it to the priest
They shall offer a burnt offering
They shall fast for seven days
They shall be excluded from the sanctuary
questions.correctAnswer: They shall add a fifth part and give it to the priest
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:14 requires the person who eats the holy thing unwittingly to add a fifth part and give it to the priest, illustrating the principle of restitution and atonement (cf. Exodus 22:3-4; Numbers 5:7; Luke 19:8; Romans 3:25).

questions.question: What is the requirement for offerings to be acceptable to the LORD as stated in Leviticus 22:19-20?
options: They must be a male without blemish
They can have minor blemishes
They can be female or male
They may be old or young
questions.correctAnswer: They must be a male without blemish
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:19-20 requires offerings to be a male without blemish to be acceptable, symbolizing the perfection required for atonement (cf. Exodus 12:5; 1 Peter 1:19; Hebrews 9:14; Revelation 5:6).

questions.question: Which of the following defects disqualifies an animal from being offered according to Leviticus 22:22?
options: Blindness
Old age
Being female
Having a short tail
questions.correctAnswer: Blindness
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:22 lists blindness among defects that disqualify animals from offerings, underscoring the demand for perfection in sacrifices (cf. Leviticus 1:3; Deuteronomy 15:21; 1 Corinthians 13:11; Hebrews 10:1-4).

questions.question: According to Leviticus 22:23, what is the difference in acceptability of animals with superfluous or lacking parts for freewill offerings versus vows?
options: They may be offered for freewill offerings but not for vows
They are accepted for both freewill offerings and vows
They are rejected for both
They may be offered for vows but not freewill offerings
questions.correctAnswer: They may be offered for freewill offerings but not for vows
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:23 states animals with superfluous or lacking parts may be offered as freewill offerings but not for vows, showing the stricter requirements for vow offerings (cf. Numbers 6:14; Deuteronomy 23:21; Psalm 50:9-13; Hebrews 10:5-7).

questions.question: What instruction does Leviticus 22:27 give regarding the age of animals before they can be offered by fire to the LORD?
options: They must be at least eight days old
They may be offered immediately upon birth
They must be at least one month old
They must be a year old
questions.correctAnswer: They must be at least eight days old
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:27 instructs that animals must be seven days with their dam and from the eighth day onward may be offered, ensuring proper development before sacrifice (cf. Luke 1:59; Exodus 13:12-15; Deuteronomy 15:19; Hebrews 9:12).

questions.question: What does Leviticus 22:28 forbid concerning a cow or ewe and her young?
options: You shall not kill both the mother and her young on the same day
You may kill both on the same day for sacrifice
You should kill the mother first
You should only kill the young
questions.correctAnswer: You shall not kill both the mother and her young on the same day
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:28 forbids killing a mother and her young on the same day, expressing respect for the life-giving relationship and stewardship (cf. Deuteronomy 22:6-7; Proverbs 12:10; Matthew 6:26; Romans 12:1).

questions.question: According to Leviticus 22:30, what is the rule regarding the timing of eating a sacrifice of thanksgiving?
options: It must be eaten on the same day with none left until the next day
It can be eaten anytime within a week
It may be saved for several days
It must be eaten before sunset the next day
questions.correctAnswer: It must be eaten on the same day with none left until the next day
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:30 requires thanksgiving sacrifices to be eaten on the same day with none left over, emphasizing immediacy in fellowship before God (cf. Exodus 12:10; Deuteronomy 12:15; 1 Corinthians 11:25-26; Hebrews 13:15).

questions.question: What is the theological reason given in Leviticus 22:32 for not profaning God's holy name?
options: Because God will be hallowed among the children of Israel
Because it will bring material loss
Because priests need to be respected
Because the land will become unclean
questions.correctAnswer: Because God will be hallowed among the children of Israel
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:32 explains that God's holy name must not be profaned because He will be hallowed among Israel, revealing God's holiness and covenantal relationship (cf. Exodus 20:7; Isaiah 6:3; Matthew 6:9; 1 Corinthians 10:31).

questions.question: How does Leviticus 22:33 remind Israel of God's identity and role in their lives?
options: God brought them out of Egypt to be their God
God created the heavens and the earth
God will judge all nations
God will send a prophet
questions.correctAnswer: God brought them out of Egypt to be their God
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22:33 reminds Israel that God delivered them from Egypt to be their God, affirming His covenant faithfulness and redemptive work (cf. Exodus 6:7; Deuteronomy 7:8; Romans 9:4-5; Revelation 1:5).

questions.question: Which statement best summarizes the primary theological theme of Leviticus 22?
options: The necessity of holiness and purity in approaching God and His holy things
The expansion of the priesthood to include all tribes
The allowance of imperfections in offerings for mercy
The inclusion of foreigners in eating holy offerings
questions.correctAnswer: The necessity of holiness and purity in approaching God and His holy things
questions.explanation: Leviticus 22 emphasizes holiness and purity in those who serve and approach God, highlighting God's sanctity and the need for human separation from sin (cf. 1 Peter 1:15-16; Hebrews 12:14; Isaiah 6:3; Ephesians 5:27).
